question: You recently did a short cookery courses. The cookery school has asked for your feedback on this course.Write a letter to the course director at the cookery school. In your letter describe what you enjoyed about the course. Say how much cooking you've done since the course. Suggest another cookery course you'd like the school to offer.
text: Hello, and I wish everything could be all right.
I am writing this letter because I was a member of your cookery class in which we cooked sweets and cakes.
Please accept my deep thanks for your training. I learnt some important details about your recipes which were useful for me.

Of the course, I did more exercises then I baked a wonderful cake for my son's birthday. Everyone was surprised and happy. That cake was delicious. Also, for my son's classmates, I bake some cupcakes that were similar to the main cake which was designed with blue creams.
Besides, your class was enjoyable and I did not tire of it  because I made some friends who were kind and had a fun time together. Although, we helped ourselves with coffee and sweets on that course.

May I suggest that if it is available to have a new course which you teach us healthy food? Moreover, we are youth but some of us are living with our parents, so we need to protect them from some illnesses such as blood pressure.
I trust that suggestion has been useful.
